intro: Herschelianthe spathulata subsp. tripartita, commonly known as the three-lobed pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lobed and succulent, adapted to store water in its native dry environment. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral structure and three-lobed leaf morphology.
